etymology.description: 𠨍 (𠨍) (two people facing each other) + 皀 (皀) (round-mouthed food vessel) -> original meaning 'to feast' -> phonetic borrowing or semantic shifting to mean 'village'
etymology.interpretation: The character initially represented two people facing a food vessel, symbolizing communal feasting, which was a central part of village life. Over time, it came to denote 'village' through borrowing or semantic shift, aligning with the social aspect it originally depicted.
etymology.simplification: 乡(鄉) simplifies by using a component resembling 良(良) (liáng, 'good'), unrelated to 郎(郎) (láng, 'young man'), to streamline its form, based on 皀 during the clerical script development.

examples.chinese: 我怀念乡(我懷念鄉)，那里有我的故事(那裡有我的故事)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huáiniàn xiāng, nàlǐ yǒu wǒ de gùshì.
examples.english: I miss my hometown, where my stories lie.

examples.chinese: 他常回乡(他常回鄉)，寻找旧日情怀(尋找舊日情懷)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cháng huí xiāng, xúnzhǎo jiù rì qínghuái.
examples.english: He often returns to his hometown, seeking the old sentiments.
